channel.title: My Role Playing Game
channel.description:
[img]http://i.imgur.com/LjMbjoo.png[/img] [img]http://i.imgur.com/ob4HZiJ.png[/img]
Release will be shortly, First I need some help from you guys!
I haven't really said much information about the game. It's like Runescape and other RPGs where you just walk around, chat and fight ect...
I need to come up with a new name, As my current name (Lost in Saria) isn't very good In my opinion, Your task is to suggest a new name for the RPG and you will win £10 Payable via PP or RSGP (Your choice).
GO GO GO!!!!!
COMPETITION ENDS WHEN I FIND A GOOD NAME.....
POST SUGGESTIONS BELOW! V V V

item.title: My Role Playing Game
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“xEthanx, post:15, topic:542738”][quote author=justhin10 link=topic=661613.msg4423109#msg4423109 date=1399392653]

In what game engine are you going to create this? I’m a Student Game Development (3rd years) Developing in Unity3D (JavaScript[UnityScript], C#). Lots of experience in the editor. So if you can please provide the engine you’re going to create this in. I might be interested

Why do people always ask this? You don’t need external engines, and they really aren’t that bad at all to write. The only benefit I see to Unity is what Notch said: “Unity will publish to everything, even toasters.” Unless he wants his game to be on the Xbox One, it’s not really necessary.

Why? Unity3D Has many more benefit then just publishing. It’s a free “Indie” Engine that provides great tools. Also i’m a student (game development) and i’m using unity3d for almost 3 years now… now “You don’t need external engines, and they really aren’t that bad at all to write.” this part I do not understand writing an entire game engine lol goodluck with that
[/quote]
Thanks for the luck, but I’ve already written multiple of my own. And no, it isn’t as difficult as everyone claims it is. And I find it pathetic when people use Unity. It’s a shortcut in my eyes, with not near the customization of your own engine.

I feel like people now adays just accept everything that’s offered to them on a platter, and never question if it’s better to learn it the hard way. The benefits of learning to write and writing your own faaaaar exceed using Unity.[/quote]
I don’t see how using Unity is pathetic. Would you rather spend x time and produce a good game or spend the same value of time and get nowhere near completion because you had the idea you had to build everything yourself. Are you a very experienced programmer or someone who thinks they know better than quite a large quantity of very experienced programmers? In a lot of cases using Unity is taking the sensible option; of course not using Unity is a valid option too but you shouldn’t slate on the use of unity.

P.S. Add media and change your font colour; as the OP isn’t exactly interesting/aesthetically pleasing.

Read full topic

item.title: My Role Playing Game
item.dc:creator: @xEthanx xEthanx
item.description:
@xEthanx wrote:

[quote=“justhin10, post:13, topic:542738”][quote author=xEthanx link=topic=661613.msg4422961#msg4422961 date=1399329344]

In what game engine are you going to create this? I’m a Student Game Development (3rd years) Developing in Unity3D (JavaScript[UnityScript], C#). Lots of experience in the editor. So if you can please provide the engine you’re going to create this in. I might be interested

Why do people always ask this? You don’t need external engines, and they really aren’t that bad at all to write. The only benefit I see to Unity is what Notch said: “Unity will publish to everything, even toasters.” Unless he wants his game to be on the Xbox One, it’s not really necessary.
[/quote]

Why? Unity3D Has many more benefit then just publishing. It’s a free “Indie” Engine that provides great tools. Also i’m a student (game development) and i’m using unity3d for almost 3 years now… now “You don’t need external engines, and they really aren’t that bad at all to write.” this part I do not understand writing an entire game engine lol goodluck with that :D[/quote]
Thanks for the luck, but I’ve already written multiple of my own. And no, it isn’t as difficult as everyone claims it is. And I find it pathetic when people use Unity. It’s a shortcut in my eyes, with not near the customization of your own engine.

I feel like people now adays just accept everything that’s offered to them on a platter, and never question if it’s better to learn it the hard way. The benefits of learning to write and writing your own faaaaar exceed using Unity.

Read full topic

item.title: My Role Playing Game
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Limit the scope for the game and make it completable. Making a too big world will just make it empty and dull with a couple of radrouches in your way. Rather try to make it interesting in smaller places.

Suggestion for name: “Canada, eh”. Lots of wasteland and nothing exiting apart from the border regions.

Read full topic

item.title: My Role Playing Game
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“Docent, post:6, topic:542738”][quote author=xEthanx link=topic=661613.msg4422314#msg4422314 date=1399061192]
Way less text, way more media. Sorry but no one cares when you babble on about all the awesome features of your game, people are just too short-sighted for that. Think about the appeal of your post aesthetically.
[/quote]

^ and take a look at the game market right now. People would rather buy a game with hyper-realistic graphics with small amounts of content than a game with a lot of content but absolutely horrid graphics.[/quote]
well duhh, we’re humans :palm:

Read full topic
